tit.e: Ohitashi (boiled greens with soy sauce dressing)
tit.cmt: 後列で「調理法の一種」とあるのことから、ここでは"with soy sauce dressing"を削除しました。

sen.j: おひたし（御浸し、ひたし、ひたし物とも）とは、調理法の1種である。
sen.e: Ohitashi (also called hitashi or hitashimono) is a kind of recipes.
Ohitashi (also called hitashi or hitashimono) is a kind of cookery.
Ohitashi (also called hitashi or hitashimono) is a kind of cookery.

sen.j: 出汁に浸す過程より派生した調理名であるが、この工程は省かれることも多く、単に茹でた食材に醤油をかけたものもおひたしと呼ばれる。
sen.e: This recipe name is derived from the process to soak ingredients in soup stock, but this process is often skipped and boiled foods with soy sauce on it is simply called ohitashi.
This cookery name is derived from the process to soak ingredients in soup stock, but this process is often skipped, and simply boiled foods with soy sauce on it is also called ohitashi.
sen.cmt: recipe→cookery と修正しました。ここでの「単に」は”茹でた食材に醤油をかけたもの”を修飾していると考えます。
sen.e: This cookery name is derived from the process to soak ingredients in soup stock, but this process is often skipped, and simply boiled foods with soy sauce on it is also called ohitashi.

sen.j: 古くは浸物と表記された。
sen.e: In ancient times, ohitashi was written "浸物" (hitashimono) in Japanese kanji characters.
In ancient times, ohitashi was written as "浸物" (hitashimono).
sen.cmt: as を挿入し、in 以下を削除しました。
sen.e: In ancient times, ohitashi was written as "浸物" (hitashimono).

sen.j: 奈良時代の文書からもこの調理法があったことが推定されているが、戦国時代_(日本)の永正14年（1517年）の記録に「ヒタシ物」という語句が出現する。
sen.e: It is estimated that this recipe existed based on documents in the Nara period and the word "Hitashimono" also appeared in the records in 1517 in the Sengoku period (period of warring states in Japan).

It is estimated that this cookery existed based on documents in the Nara period and the word "Hitashimono" also appeared in the records in 1517 in the Sengoku period (period of warring states in Japan).

sen.j: 江戸時代には煎り酒や酢で味付けする物や原料にアワビやナマコ、クラゲなどの海産物を用いた物も存在したが、明治以後には野菜を醤油で味付けする形式が主流となった。
sen.e: In the Edo period, there were some hitashimono recipes that used boiled-down sake or vinegar as a seasoning or those used marine products as ingredients including awabi (abalone), sea cucumber, or jellyfish, but after the Meiji period, vegetable ohitashi seasoned with soy source has become the main stream recipe for ohitashi.

sen.j: 青菜、山菜、きのこなどをお湯で茹でたあとに出汁に浸し、食べる直前に水気を絞り醤油で味をつける。
sen.e: Soak aona (greens), sansai (plants growing wilds in field and mountains), or mushrooms in soup stock after boiling them and drain off water and seasoned with soy source just before serving.

sen.j: これは個人の好みで量を加減するためである。
sen.e: This is because to adjust seasoning depending on individual taste.
This is for adjusting the amount of seasoning according to individual taste.
sen.cmt: because to adjust→for adjusting the,depending on→according to と修正しました。”量（味付けの）”とし、補いました。
sen.e: This is for adjusting the amount of seasoning according to individual taste.

sen.j: なお、茹ですぎると、香りや食感がなくなるので注意を要する。
sen.e: It requires careful attention because if you boil them too long, they lose flavor and food texture.
It requires careful attention since the excess of boiling cause them to lose flavor and food texture.
sen.cmt: 文の流れをスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: It requires careful attention since the excess of boiling cause them to lose flavor and food texture.

sen.j: 最近では、電子レンジで作る場合もあるが、電子レンジで作った場合には灰汁（シュウ酸）が抜けないので、苦みが残る。
sen.e: Recently, ohitashi is sometimes made with a microwave oven, but when cooked with a microwave oven, it has some bitter aftertaste due to the remaining scum (oxalic acid).
Recently, ohitashi is sometimes cooked using microwave, but when using microwave, it has some bitter aftertaste due to the remaining scum (oxalic acid).
sen.cmt: made with a→cooked using,microwave oven→microwave,文の流れをスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: Recently, ohitashi is sometimes cooked using microwave, but when using microwave, it has some bitter aftertaste due to the remaining scum (oxalic acid).

sen.j: ほうれん草、小松菜、白菜、菜の花、春菊などが代表的な材料である。
sen.e: Typical ingredients are spinach, brassica rapa (a kind of Chinese cabbage), napa cabbage, rape blossoms, or garland chrysanthemum.
Typical ingredients are spinach, brassica rapa (a kind of Chinese cabbage), napa cabbage, rape blossom, or garland chrysanthemum.
sen.cmt: rape blossoms→rape blossom （他と統一しました）
sen.e: Typical ingredients are spinach, brassica rapa (a kind of Chinese cabbage), napa cabbage, rape blossom, or garland chrysanthemum.

sen.j: 風味付けに鰹節やゴマをかける他、出汁醤油を用いることもある。
sen.e: Dried bonito flakes and sesame seeds as well as Dashi-shoyu (soy sauce broth) are also used as a flavoring in ohitashi.
As well as dried bonito flakes and sesame seeds, Dashi-shoyu (soy sauce broth) is also used as a flavoring in ohitashi.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正しました。are→is と修正しました。

tit.e: Agebitashi (deep-fried vegetables in soy and mirin broth)
Agebitashi (deep-fried vegetables in soy and mirin broth)
Agebitashi (deep-fried vegetables in soy and mirin broth)

sen.j: ナスなど茹でずに油で揚げて熱湯をかけて油抜きしたものを調味した出し汁に浸したものも、おひたしの一種であり、この場合はとくに揚げ浸し（あげびたし）という。
sen.e: Vegetables such as eggplants which are not boiled but deep fried and soaked in seasoned soup stock after removing oil by spilling hot water are also a kind of ohitashi and in this case, it is called "agebitashi."

Vegetables such as eggplants which are not boiled but deep fried and soaked in seasoned soup stock after removing oil by pouring boiling water are also a kind of ohitashi and in this case, it is particularly called "agebitashi."
sen.cmt: spilling→pouring,hot→boiling と修正し、「とくに」を補いました。
sen.e: Vegetables such as eggplants which are not boiled but deep fried and soaked in seasoned soup stock after removing oil by pouring boiling water are also a kind of ohitashi and in this case, it is particularly called "agebitashi."
